title: North America Tipped to Account for the Largest Share of the Global Nuclear Medicine Equipment Market in 2015 - Literated Market Research
text:
Generator manufacturers and radio pharmaceutical processors have adopted two major market strategies in the global nuclear medicines market. Shifting of the operational model towards LEU (Low Enriched Uranium) from HEU (High Enriched Uranium) for Mo-99 production was a major trend in the processor market. Since the limited half-life is a major concern in radioisotopes distribution, the prime aim of generator manufacturers was the ensuring of a sustainable supply chain.
Competition in the nuclear medical equipment market has been increased with the advent of many local players who are expected to capitalize on domestic opportunities in various countries through the growing trend of using cyclotrons and alternative production methods of Tc-99m production which offers vast opportunities for new market entrants.
The main developments followed by the key players in the global nuclear medicine market include acquisitions, new product developments, agreements and collaborations and expansions.
There have been various advancements in products and their approvals over the years in the nuclear medical equipment market that meets the needs of patients and the radiologists. While some of the existing nuclear medicine equipments have improved, there are many new ones that have been introduced due to the advancements.
The largest share of nuclear medicine equipment market, by product, is expected to be accounted for by the SPECT systems in 2015. The hybrid SPECT systems are likely to command the largest share within the SPECT segment and it is expected to grow at a higher CAGR during the coming years.
According to analysts, the largest share of the global nuclear medicine equipment market, by application, is expected to be held by the cardiology application segment
In terms of users of nuclear medical equipment, hospitals would rule the roost and will account for the largest share of the global market. A major factor for the large share hospitals in the global nuclear medicine equipment market is the increased adoption of nuclear imaging equipment by hospitals around the world.
North America is tipped to account for the largest share of the global nuclear medicine equipment market, followed by Europe, Asia-Pacific and the Rest of the World in 2015.
Asia Pacific region is expected to show the highest growth in the segment majorly due to increasing research and development investments, expansion of international players and increasing disease burden and favorable regulatory framework.
